tutorial.title: Net Present Value (NPV) of a Series of Uneven Cash Flows
tutorial.scenario:
Beth is planning to invest $4,000 with a discount rate of 9.75%. She has calculated that her expected cash flows for the next five years will be as shown below. What is the NPV of her investment?

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries. Then, press the CF button to access the Cash Flow mode.
Enter the initial cash outflow (in this case 4000), and then press the +/- button.
Press the ENTER button to store this as the initial cash investment.
Press ↓, enter the first cash inflow amount (in this case 2500), and then press the ENTER button to store this cash flow amount.
Press ↓ to record that (in this case) the cash inflow of 2500 occurs only once.
Press ↓, enter the second cash inflow amount (in this case 1500), and then press the ENTER button to store this cash flow amount.
Press ↓ to record that (in this case) the cash inflow of 1500 occurs only once.
Press ↓, enter the third cash inflow amount (in this case 1000 ), and then press the ENTER button to store this cash flow amount.
Press ↓. Then, press 2 followed by the ENTER button to record that (in this case) the cash inflow of 1000 occurs twice.
Press ↓, enter the fourth cash inflow amount (in this case 800), and then press the ENTER button to store this cash flow amount.
Enter the discount rate (in this case 9.75), and then press the I/Y button.
Press the CPT button and then the NPV button to calculate the net present value of the investment.
